cdm.description: The Plan Canonical Data Model represents how pharmacy and medical benefits are structured, priced, and administered within a PBM operating in a passthrough model. It unifies plan design, benefits, networks, coverage rules, and group-level configuration. It must support both standard PBM plans and the added complexity of specialty drug management and care coordination programs.

ncpdp_general_standards.name: Formulary and Benefit (F&B) Standard
ncpdp_general_standards.reasoning: Primary source for plan-level formulary structure and benefit design: formulary IDs, tiering, PA/QL/ST indicators, preferred status, mail/specialty flags, and cost-sharing ranges by tier—directly drives entities like Formulary, Tier, CoverageRule, and PlanCostShare.

ncpdp_general_standards.name: Real-Time Prescription Benefit (RTPB) Standard
ncpdp_general_standards.reasoning: Delivers patient-specific benefit estimates at prescribing, including covered alternatives, tier, utilization management requirements, network type (retail/mail/specialty), days supply options, and member liability—supports BenefitDesign, CoverageRule, and NetworkOption attributes.

ncpdp_general_standards.name: Telecommunications Standard – Insurance Segment
ncpdp_general_standards.reasoning: Contains core plan routing/identification keys (BIN, PCN, Group ID, Cardholder/Person codes) that define Plan, Group, and CoverageSet entities and enable mapping between member coverage and plan configurations.

ncpdp_general_standards.name: Manufacturer Rebate Standard (MRS)
ncpdp_general_standards.reasoning: Captures rebate program identifiers, contract terms, NDC eligibility, timeframes, and utilization linkage—supports RebateProgram, ProductRebateTerm, and PlanRebateLink entities critical to passthrough pricing and specialty management.

ncpdp_script_standards.name: SCRIPT – Electronic Prior Authorization (ePA)
ncpdp_script_standards.reasoning: Defines PA initiation/response structures including coverage criteria, step therapy, quantity limits, indications, PA status/number, effective dates, and denial reasons—directly supports PriorAuthorizationPolicy, CoverageRule, and UMCriteria attributes for the plan.

ncpdp_assessment.notes: NCPDP standards provide the authoritative pharmacy plan identifiers (BIN/PCN/Group) and the operational formulary, cost-sharing, and utilization management attributes needed for a PBM Plan CDM. Compared to HL7 FHIR (e.g., InsurancePlan/Formulary), NCPDP offers more granular, transaction-proven pharmacy benefit data (pricing details, PA/QL/ST flags, RTPB estimates) essential for PBM configuration and specialty program alignment.
